definitions: express or communicate something through bodily movements and gestures without using spoken words
copy or mimic someone's actions or behavior in an exaggerated silent manner
examples: The actor pantomimed opening a heavy door during rehearsal
She pantomimed eating to show she was hungry
The children pantomimed their teacher behind her back playfully
He pantomimed the entire scene for his confused colleague

definitions: apply paper as a covering material to walls or other surfaces for decoration
provide written documentation or credentials to establish something officially or formally
examples: They papered the bedroom walls with floral designs yesterday
We need to paper this entire room before painting
The company properly papered all their international shipments
You must paper your qualifications before the interview

definitions: jump from an aircraft and descend slowly using a parachute device
drop supplies or personnel from an aircraft using parachute equipment
arrive somewhere suddenly especially to take control or provide emergency assistance
examples: The soldiers parachuted into enemy territory at dawn
She parachuted from fifteen thousand feet yesterday
They parachuted medical supplies to the remote village
The military parachuted food into the disaster zone
The new manager parachuted in to save the company
Corporate headquarters parachuted experts to handle the crisis

definitions: walk or march in a public procession especially for celebration or demonstration
display or show something or someone prominently often in a boastful manner
examples: The veterans paraded through downtown on Memorial Day
Students paraded around campus protesting the new policy
She paraded her new engagement ring at the party
He constantly parades his wealth before his colleagues

definitions: extend in the same direction while maintaining equal distance at all points
be similar or correspond to something in nature features or development pattern
examples: The new highway parallels the old railroad tracks
The river parallels the mountain range for miles
Her career trajectory paralleled that of her mentor
This situation parallels what happened last year exactly

definitions: cause a person or body part to lose the ability to move or function
make unable to function move or act effectively through fear shock or overwhelming force
examples: The accident paralyzed him from the waist down permanently
The venom can paralyze victims within minutes of injection
Fear completely paralyzed her during the emergency situation
The strike paralyzed the city's transportation system for weeks

definitions: express the meaning of something using different words especially to achieve greater clarity
examples: The teacher asked students to paraphrase the complex paragraph
Could you paraphrase that technical explanation more simply please
She paraphrased the ancient text for modern readers carefully
He paraphrased the CEO's remarks in his report

definitions: divide something into parts or portions for distribution or separate handling
wrap or pack something into a parcel or package for sending
examples: They parceled the land among the three heirs equally
The committee parceled out responsibilities to different departments
She carefully parceled the fragile items for international shipping
We need to parcel these gifts before the holidays

definitions: grant forgiveness for an offense especially through official or legal authority
politely ask someone to excuse a minor fault or request repetition
examples: The governor pardoned several non-violent offenders last month
The president can pardon federal crimes under constitutional authority
Pardon me for interrupting your important conversation
Could you pardon me while I squeeze past you

definitions: cut away the outer layer or edge of something using a knife or similar tool
reduce or diminish something gradually by removing unnecessary parts or expenses
examples: She carefully pared the apple before making the pie
The chef pared the vegetables with expert knife skills
The company needs to pare its operating costs significantly
They pared down the guest list to immediate family only

definitions: bring up and care for a child as their mother or father
perform the duties and responsibilities of being a mother or father
examples: They parented three children while building successful careers
She parented her nephew after her sister passed away
He parents with patience and understanding every single day
Learning to parent effectively takes time and dedication

definitions: bring a vehicle to a stop and leave it temporarily in a particular place
put or leave something in a particular place or position temporarily
examples: Please park your car in the designated visitor area
She parked illegally and received an expensive ticket
He parked himself on the couch all afternoon
Just park those boxes in the corner for now

definitions: hold a conference or discussion especially between enemies or opposing sides to settle disputes
examples: The generals decided to parley before resuming the battle
The union representatives parleyed with management for three days
Pirates would often parley with naval officers for safe passage
The warring tribes agreed to parley at neutral territory

definitions: produce a humorous or satirical imitation of a serious work or style for comic effect
examples: The comedian brilliantly parodied the president's speaking style
They parodied famous movie scenes in their sketch show
The writer parodied Victorian novels in her latest book
Students parodied their principal's morning announcements for talent show

definitions: release a prisoner temporarily or permanently before completing their sentence on condition of good behavior
examples: The board decided to parole him after serving ten years
They paroled several inmates who showed genuine rehabilitation progress
The judge refused to parole the violent offender early
Prisoners paroled early must report to officers monthly

definitions: repeat or copy someone's words or actions especially without understanding their meaning
examples: The child simply parroted what his older brother said
Students shouldn't just parrot textbook definitions without comprehension
She parroted the company line without any personal conviction
He parrots political talking points he heard on television

definitions: ward off a weapon or attack with a countermove especially in fencing or combat
avoid answering a question or dealing with a criticism in a clever way
examples: The fencer expertly parried every thrust from his opponent
She parried the sword strike with her shield effectively
The politician parried difficult questions about the scandal
He parried her criticism with a witty comeback

definitions: analyze a sentence into its grammatical parts and describe their syntactic roles
examine or analyze something methodically and in detail especially data or information
examples: Students must parse complex sentences in advanced grammar class
The software can parse natural language queries automatically
Researchers carefully parsed the data looking for meaningful patterns
We need to parse these survey results before the meeting

definitions: participate or become involved in an activity or event with others
eat drink or consume something especially as part of a shared meal
examples: Everyone was invited to partake in the celebration
She rarely partakes in office gossip or politics
Would you like to partake of our traditional feast
They partook of wine and bread during the ceremony

definitions: take part or become actively involved in an activity event or situation
examples: All students must participate in at least one sport
She actively participates in community volunteer programs every weekend
Employees are encouraged to participate in training workshops
Many countries participated in the international climate summit

definitions: divide a space or area by erecting a physical barrier or wall
divide something into distinct parts or sections for separate use or consideration
examples: They partitioned the large room to create two offices
The landlord partitioned the apartment into smaller rental units
The hard drive was partitioned into three logical drives
They partitioned the inheritance according to the will

definitions: work together with someone as partners in an activity or business
join with another person or organization to form a partnership
examples: She partnered with him on several research projects
The two companies partnered to develop new technology
He partnered his brother in the family business
They decided to partner after years of competition

definitions: attend or host social gatherings for entertainment and celebration
engage in lively social activities especially involving music dancing and drinking
examples: They partied until dawn at the beach house
We're going to party for her birthday this weekend
College students often party too hard during spring break
He partied every night during his vacation in Vegas

definitions: attach or stick something to a surface using paste glue or similar adhesive
insert text or data that has been copied from another location in computing
examples: The children pasted colorful pictures into their scrapbooks
She carefully pasted the wallpaper to avoid air bubbles
You can paste the formatted text into your document
He pasted the data from the spreadsheet into his report

definitions: put animals in a pasture to feed on grass or allow them to graze
examples: The farmer pastures his cattle in the meadow
They pastured the horses near the stream all summer
Sheep have pastured on these hills for generations
We pasture our goats on organic grassland only

definitions: touch someone or something gently and repeatedly with the flat hand
shape or flatten something by gentle repeated touching or pressing
examples: She patted the dog's head affectionately
He patted his friend on the back encouragingly
Pat the dough into a flat circle shape
She patted her hair into place before the photo

definitions: mend or strengthen a damaged area by covering it with material
repair or improve something in a makeshift or temporary way
examples: She patched the torn jeans with decorative fabric
We need to patch this hole in the wall
They patched their relationship after the big argument
The programmer patched the software to fix security vulnerabilities

definitions: obtain an official patent granting exclusive rights to an invention or process
examples: The inventor patented her revolutionary new design last year
You should patent this idea before someone else does
The company has patented dozens of innovative technologies
They patented the manufacturing process to protect their investment

definitions: keep watch over an area by regularly walking or traveling around it
examples: Security guards patrol the premises every two hours
Police officers patrol this neighborhood throughout the night
Border agents patrol the frontier using various surveillance methods
The soldiers patrolled the perimeter of their base camp

definitions: provide support or financial backing to a person organization or cause as a patron
examples: Wealthy collectors often patronage emerging artists and galleries
The duchess decided to patronage the local theater company
Many businesses patronage community sports teams through sponsorships
He patronaged several charitable organizations throughout his lifetime

definitions: make a repeated light tapping sound like rain or quick footsteps
talk rapidly and continuously in a glib or mechanical way
examples: Rain pattered against the window all night long
Her heels pattered across the marble floor quickly
The auctioneer pattered through the items at incredible speed
He pattered nervously while waiting for the interview

definitions: use something as a model or example to base something else on
arrange or decorate something with a repeated decorative design
examples: She patterned her teaching style after her mentor
The new law was patterned on successful European models
They patterned the fabric with geometric shapes and colors
The artist patterned the wall with intricate designs

definitions: interrupt an action or speech temporarily before continuing with the activity
examples: She paused mid-sentence to gather her thoughts carefully
The speaker paused for dramatic effect before revealing results
He paused the video to answer an important phone call
Workers paused their construction during the heavy rainstorm

definitions: cover a surface or path with concrete asphalt stones or bricks to make it suitable for walking or driving
examples: They paved the dirt road with asphalt last summer
The city plans to pave all remaining gravel streets
Workers paved the driveway with decorative stone blocks
We should pave this pathway to prevent mud problems

definitions: touch or strike something with a paw or hand in a clumsy way
touch or handle someone or something roughly or with unwanted familiarity
examples: The cat pawed at the door wanting to go outside
The dog pawed the ground before lying down
Stop pawing through my personal belongings without permission
He pawed at her arm trying to get attention

definitions: leave an item with a pawnbroker as security for a loan
use a person or thing for one's own advantage without regard for them
examples: He pawned his watch to pay the rent
She had to pawn her jewelry during tough times
The company pawned its employees in corporate power games
Don't let yourself be pawned in their political schemes

definitions: give someone money that is due for work goods or a debt
be profitable or advantageous resulting in benefit or success
suffer a loss or other misfortune as a consequence of an action
examples: She pays her bills online every month
The company pays its employees twice per month
Crime doesn't pay in the long run
It pays to arrive early for the best seats
He paid dearly for his careless mistakes
You'll pay for breaking your promise to her

definitions: inform on someone or reveal their wrongdoing to an authority figure
examples: The criminal peached on his accomplices for a reduced sentence
She threatened to peach to the teacher about their prank
He peached to the boss about his coworkers' long lunches
Don't peach on your friends over something so trivial

definitions: reach the highest point level or degree of development activity or achievement
examples: Sales typically peak during the holiday shopping season
Her athletic performance peaked at age twenty-five
The storm will peak overnight with heavy winds expected
Interest in the story peaked after the documentary aired

definitions: ring out loudly and sonorously especially of bells or thunder
burst out with a loud sound especially of laughter or thunder
examples: Church bells pealed across the valley on Sunday morning
Thunder pealed ominously in the darkening sky
Laughter pealed from the children's playground
The bells pealed joyfully announcing the royal wedding

definitions: form into small round drops resembling pearls especially of liquid
dive or fish for pearls in their natural habitat
examples: Dewdrops pearled on the spider's web at dawn
Sweat pearled on his forehead during the workout
Divers have pearled in these waters for centuries
They pearled along the coast during summer months

definitions: strike or bite something with a beak or pointed tool repeatedly
give someone a quick light kiss usually on the cheek
examples: The hen pecked at scattered corn in the yard
Woodpeckers pecked holes in the old tree trunk
She pecked him on the cheek before leaving
He pecked his grandmother goodbye at the door

definitions: push the pedals of a bicycle or other pedal-operated vehicle or machine
propel a bicycle or similar vehicle by pushing the pedals with feet
examples: She pedaled the organ during the church service
You need to pedal harder to climb this hill
He pedaled to work every morning for exercise
They pedaled along the scenic coastal path yesterday

definitions: travel around selling goods especially in small quantities directly to people
try to sell or promote an idea or view persistently or widely
examples: He peddled household goods from door to door
Street vendors peddle souvenirs to tourists downtown
Politicians peddle their promises during election campaigns
She's been peddling that conspiracy theory for years

definitions: pass urine from the body through the urinary system
examples: The toddler needs to pee before the long car ride
Dogs often pee on trees to mark their territory
She had to pee urgently during the movie
Please pee in the designated restroom facilities only

definitions: look quickly and secretly at something especially through a small opening
examples: She peeked through the curtains at the visitors
The child peeked around the corner cautiously
Don't peek at your presents before Christmas morning
He couldn't resist peeking at the test answers

definitions: remove the outer covering or skin from a fruit or vegetable
come off in strips or small pieces especially of a surface layer
examples: She carefully peeled the orange for her child
You should peel potatoes before boiling them
Paint is peeling off the old wooden fence
His sunburned skin began peeling after several days

definitions: look quickly and secretly at something often through a narrow opening
make a weak shrill sound like that of a young bird
examples: She peeped through the keyhole to see inside
Children were peeping over the fence curiously
Baby chicks peeped loudly in their nest
Not a sound peeped from the sleeping children

definitions: look steadily and intently especially when trying to see more clearly
examples: She peered through the fog trying to find landmarks
He peered at the tiny print without his glasses
Scientists peered into the microscope examining the specimen
The detective peered closely at the mysterious footprints

definitions: fasten or attach something using a peg pin or similar pointed device
classify or categorize someone or something in a particular way
examples: She pegged the laundry on the line to dry
They pegged the tent securely to the ground
Don't peg me as just another boring accountant
Critics pegged the film as this year's sleeper hit
